**板甲**（plate mail）是[NetHack](/index.php?title=NetHack/zh-CN\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "NetHack/zh-CN (page does not exist)")中的一种[铠甲](/wiki/%E9%93%A0%E7%94%B2 "铠甲")类[防具](/wiki/%E9%98%B2%E5%85%B7 "防具")。板甲由[铁](/index.php?title=%E9%93%81\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "铁 (page does not exist)")制成。[武士](/index.php?title=%E6%AD%A6%E5%A3%AB\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "武士 (page does not exist)")称其为**短甲**（tanko）。

## 生成

[Rogue关卡](/index.php?title=Rogue%E5%85%B3%E5%8D%A1\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Rogue关卡 (page does not exist)")的假[骨档](/index.php?title=%E9%AA%A8%E6%A1%A3\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "骨档 (page does not exist)")有1⁄2的概率生成一件板甲，该板甲有1⁄3的概率是防[侵蚀](/index.php?title=%E4%BE%B5%E8%9A%80\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "侵蚀 (page does not exist)")的，有3⁄4的概率是被诅咒的，其[附魔](/index.php?title=%E9%99%84%E9%AD%94\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "附魔 (page does not exist)")等级在-1到+3之间[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)。

生成时目标[AC](/index.php?title=AC/zh-CN\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "AC/zh-CN (page does not exist)")为-1或更好的[雇佣兵](/index.php?title=%E9%9B%87%E4%BD%A3%E5%85%B5\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "雇佣兵 (page does not exist)")（如[岩德军团](/index.php?title=%E5%B2%A9%E5%BE%B7%E5%86%9B%E5%9B%A2\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "岩德军团 (page does not exist)")[中尉](/index.php?title=%E4%B8%AD%E5%B0%89\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "中尉 (page does not exist)")）有16⁄25的概率[获得](/index.php?title=%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9%E8%B5%B7%E5%A7%8B%E7%89%A9%E5%93%81\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "怪物起始物品 (page does not exist)")一件板甲[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)。

[野蛮人](/index.php?title=%E9%87%8E%E8%9B%AE%E4%BA%BA%EF%BC%88%E7%8E%A9%E5%AE%B6%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9%EF%BC%89\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "野蛮人（玩家怪物） (page does not exist)")、[骑士](/index.php?title=%E9%AA%91%E5%A3%AB%EF%BC%88%E7%8E%A9%E5%AE%B6%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9%EF%BC%89\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "骑士（玩家怪物） (page does not exist)")、[牧师](/index.php?title=%E7%89%A7%E5%B8%88%EF%BC%88%E7%8E%A9%E5%AE%B6%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9%EF%BC%89\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "牧师（玩家怪物） (page does not exist)")和[女武神](/index.php?title=%E5%A5%B3%E6%AD%A6%E7%A5%9E%EF%BC%88%E7%8E%A9%E5%AE%B6%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "女武神（玩家怪物 (page does not exist)")职业的[玩家怪物](/index.php?title=%E7%8E%A9%E5%AE%B6%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "玩家怪物 (page does not exist)")在生成时有11⁄155（约7.1%）的概率携带一件板甲[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)。

*以下内容涉及即将到来的版本（[NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")）之信息。如果该版本已发布，请验证此处信息是否准确，并作出相应修改，以将其并入页面。*

根据[commit 20cbadcf](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/20cbadcf85544cf9d0c3f4e4200b2800bab49c8e)，[骑士任务](/index.php?title=%E9%AA%91%E5%A3%AB%E4%BB%BB%E5%8A%A1\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "骑士任务 (page does not exist)")的领袖[亚瑟王](/index.php?title=%E4%BA%9A%E7%91%9F%E7%8E%8B\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "亚瑟王 (page does not exist)")生成时会携带一件+4板甲。

## 描述

板甲的基础[AC](/index.php?title=AC/zh-CN\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "AC/zh-CN (page does not exist)")加成为7，且提供[MC](/index.php?title=MC/zh-CN\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "MC/zh-CN (page does not exist)")2。

## 策略

板甲是除[龙鳞甲](/wiki/%E9%BE%99%E9%B3%9E%E7%94%B2 "龙鳞甲")外基础AC加成最高的铠甲之一，但是非常重（450 [aum](/index.php?title=Aum/zh-CN\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Aum/zh-CN (page does not exist)")），因此多数角色都很难使用，[负重](/index.php?title=%E8%B4%9F%E9%87%8D\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "负重 (page does not exist)")能力高的非施法角色可以在前期穿板甲作为过渡，不过，考虑到重量管理，后续换用[秘银胶衣](/wiki/%E7%A7%98%E9%93%B6%E8%83%B6%E8%A1%A3 "秘银胶衣")仍可能是更优选。

## 历史

板甲最初于[Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack")的衍生作品Hack 1.21和Hack for PDP-11出现，也是[Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0")中最初加入游戏的物品之一。

## 起源

[![维基百科](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "维基百科")

[维基百科](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/zh:Main_Page "wikipedia:zh:Main Page")相关条目：

***[Plate armour](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plate_armour "wikipedia:Plate armour")***

[![维基百科](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "维基百科")

[维基百科](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/zh:Main_Page "wikipedia:zh:Main Page")相关条目：

***[Tankō](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tank%C5%8D "wikipedia:Tankō")***

板甲由大块金属板构成。最简单的板甲是胸甲（cuirass），由数块保护躯干的护板组成，而全身板甲（full plate）则包括了由分段的护甲板组成的头盔、护手等部分，用于保护全身。NetHack中的板甲不包含头盔、护手或靴子，因此应该属于胸甲。

“短甲”（tankō）是日本的一种板甲，其历史最早可以追溯到古坟时代（公元300—538）。短甲由重叠或铆接的铁板条制成，内衬有鞣制皮革，以保护穿戴者的衣物和身体，并在臀部系紧以贴合身体。

古希腊和古罗马人有使用保护躯干的板甲，但在罗马帝国衰亡后，这类板甲在欧洲因造价和制造难度等问题逐渐淡出，并被更易于制作的[锁子甲](/wiki/%E9%94%81%E5%AD%90%E7%94%B2 "锁子甲")取代。但由金属板制成的单件护甲逐渐流行起来，并在中世纪晚期逐渐形成全套板甲。

虽然板甲显得沉重笨拙，但全套板甲的重量（若制作工艺足够精良，不会超过25 kg）实际上会分摊到穿戴者全身，优质的板甲还会有分节化设计，因此穿戴者能最大限度保持灵活性。

当代的防弹装甲通常会在内部安装大块由金属、陶瓷或合成材料制成的护板。

## Variants

**此条目或段落的部分内容需要翻译。**  
您可以帮助我们[**翻译此页面**](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Plate_mail/zh-CN\&action=edit)，但**请勿使用机器翻译**。

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight") start the game with +0 plate mail.

Plate mail can be found on the goal level of the [Yeoman quest](/wiki/Yeoman_quest "Yeoman quest"), placed on the [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") of the lawful [temple](/wiki/Temple "Temple").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), plate mail grants 5 AC, 5 [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") and MC3 while worn, and its weight is reduced to 225 aum.

[Vlad the Impaler](/wiki/Vlad_the_Impaler_\(dNetHack\) "Vlad the Impaler (dNetHack)") is always generated with plate mail. The [militant cleric](/wiki/Militant_cleric "Militant cleric") of the rebel party that serves as the collective [quest nemeses](/wiki/Quest_nemeses "Quest nemeses") for the [Noble](/wiki/Noble "Noble")'s [default quest](/wiki/Noble_quest "Noble quest") always generates with plate mail. [Large dogs](/wiki/Large_dog "Large dog") have an effective 1⁄1000 chance of generating with plate mail fitted to their size and body shape.

[Soldier ants](/wiki/Soldier_ant "Soldier ant") and [queen bees](/wiki/Queen_bee "Queen bee") generated on the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Law_quest_\(dNetHack\) "Law quest (dNetHack)") have an effective 3⁄50 chance of generating with plate mail fitted to their size and body shape. Fighter driver [Amm Kamerel](/wiki/Amm_Kamerel "Amm Kamerel") always generate with +1 plate mail, which has an equal probability of its [material](/wiki/Object_materials_\(dNetHack\) "Object materials (dNetHack)") being either [bronze](/wiki/Bronze "Bronze"), [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver") or [glass](/wiki/Glass "Glass"). The four player monster knights generated on the Ancient Temple floor of the [Chaos Temple Quest](/wiki/Chaos_Temple_Quest "Chaos Temple Quest") each have plate mail placed on their square.

There are a few [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") sets of plate mail:

- [Soulmirror](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Soulmirror "DNetHack artifacts") is a neutral artifact that is made of [mithril](/wiki/Mithril "Mithril"): it grants [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"), MC3, and [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") while worn, and can be enchanted to +7. One of the possible item sets for minor spire [map inclusions](/wiki/Map_inclusion_\(dNetHack\)#Minor_spire "Map inclusion (dNetHack)") contains Soulmirror, and it will be replaced with normal mithril plate mail and an [amulet of reflection](/wiki/Amulet_of_reflection "Amulet of reflection") if Soulmirror was generated previously.
- [The Armor of Erebor](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Armor_of_Erebor "DNetHack artifacts") is a lawful artifact that is the [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") for [dwarven](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") Nobles, and grants [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance"), [half physical damage](/wiki/Half_physical_damage "Half physical damage"), +10 AC, [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") and [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance") while worn.
- [The Ringed Brass Armor](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Ringed_Brass_Armor "DNetHack artifacts") is a chaotic intelligent artifact that is made of copper, and acts as the [crowning](/wiki/Crowning "Crowning") gift for chaotic female [half-dragon](/wiki/Half-dragon_\(starting_race\) "Half-dragon (starting race)") Nobles. It can be safely enchanted to +10, and acts as a "living item" while worn, having a chance per turn of lashing out at any hostile monsters within 2 squares of the wearer. It has three random effects when lashing out, and [invoking](/wiki/Invoking "Invoking") the Armor will cause one of these effects to occur immediately.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), Croesus always generates with gold body armor - the armor has a 1⁄8 chance of being plate mail, and will otherwise be [chain mail](/wiki/Chain_mail "Chain mail").

### notdNetHack

In [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), in addition to dNetHack details, [Berith](/wiki/Berith "Berith") and [Dantalion](/wiki/Dantalion "Dantalion") are generated with plate mail when summoned by an [Illithanachronounbinder](/wiki/Illithanachronounbinder "Illithanachronounbinder").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), plate mail's weight is reduced to 350 aum.

[human](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)"), [orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)") and [centaur](/wiki/Centaur_\(starting_race\) "Centaur (starting race)") Knights start the game with plate mail.

Croesus has a 1⁄2 chance of generating with [gold](/wiki/Gold_\(material\) "Gold (material)") plate mail. [Kas](/wiki/Kas "Kas") is always generated with plate mail.

Plate mail can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining [chain mail](/wiki/Chain_mail "Chain mail") and [splint mail](/wiki/Splint_mail "Splint mail"). Plate mail can be used to forge a few items:

- Plate mail can be combined with 3 [dilithium crystals](/wiki/Dilithium_crystal "Dilithium crystal") to create [crystal plate mail](/wiki/Crystal_plate_mail "Crystal plate mail").
- Two sets of plate mail can be combined to create [large splint mail](/wiki/Large_splint_mail "Large splint mail").
- Plate mail can be combined with a [saddle](/wiki/Saddle "Saddle") to create [barding](/wiki/Barding_\(item\) "Barding (item)").

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, the militant cleric in the rebel party of the Noble quest generates with plate mail, as in dNetHack.

The chest within the thieves' hideout in the village of the [Town](/wiki/Town "Town") branch has a 1⁄20 chance of containing a blessed +5 plate mail named Erdrick's Armor, and an independent 3⁄20 chance of containing a cursed -5 plate mail named Alucart Mail. Erdrick's Armor is named for Erdrick, the title given to a legendary hero in the [*Dragon Quest* series](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dragon_Quest "wikipedia:Dragon Quest") of video games, with the first three games featuring a main character descended from the hero; Alucart Mail is a type of mail found in the [*Castlevania* series](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Castlevania "wikipedia:Castlevania") of video games, where it exists as an inferior knock-off of Alucard's real mail armor that can still have useful effects if paired with the other "Alucart" equipment.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), EvilHack details apply for plate mail, including generation and forging recipes.

Plate mail also generates on the temple altar in the Yeoman quest goal level, as in SLASH'EM.

## 百科文本

### 短甲

Samurai plate armor of the Yamato period (AD 300 - 710).

板甲（plate mail）是NetHack中的一种铠甲类防具。板甲由铁制成。武士称其为短甲（tanko）。

生成

Rogue关卡的假骨档有1⁄2的概率生成一件板甲，该板甲有1⁄3的概率是防侵蚀的，有3⁄4的概率是被诅咒的，其附魔等级在-1到+3之间[1]。

生成时目标AC为-1或更好的雇佣兵（如岩德军团中尉）有16⁄25的概率获得一件板甲[2]。

野蛮人、骑士、牧师和女武神职业的玩家怪物在生成时有11⁄155（约7.1%）的概率携带一件板甲[3][4][5][6]。

以下内容涉及即将到来的版本（NetHack 3.7.0）之信息。如果该版本已发布，请验证此处信息是否准确，并作出相应修改，以将其并入页面。

根据commit 20cbadcf，骑士任务的领袖亚瑟王生成时会携带一件+4板甲。

描述

板甲的基础AC加成为7，且提供MC2。

策略

板甲是除龙鳞甲外基础AC加成最高的铠甲之一，但是非常重（450 aum），因此多数角色都很难使用，负重能力高的非施法角色可以在前期穿板甲作为过渡，不过，考虑到重量管理，后续换用秘银胶衣仍可能是更优选。

历史

板甲最初于Jay Fenlason's Hack的衍生作品Hack 1.21和Hack for PDP-11出现，也是Hack 1.0中最初加入游戏的物品之一。

起源

维基百科相关条目：
Plate armour
维基百科相关条目：
Tankō

板甲由大块金属板构成。最简单的板甲是胸甲（cuirass），由数块保护躯干的护板组成，而全身板甲（full plate）则包括了由分段的护甲板组成的头盔、护手等部分，用于保护全身。NetHack中的板甲不包含头盔、护手或靴子，因此应该属于胸甲。

“短甲”（tankō）是日本的一种板甲，其历史最早可以追溯到古坟时代（公元300—538）。短甲由重叠或铆接的铁板条制成，内衬有鞣制皮革，以保护穿戴者的衣物和身体，并在臀部系紧以贴合身体。

古希腊和古罗马人有使用保护躯干的板甲，但在罗马帝国衰亡后，这类板甲在欧洲因造价和制造难度等问题逐渐淡出，并被更易于制作的锁子甲取代。但由金属板制成的单件护甲逐渐流行起来，并在中世纪晚期逐渐形成全套板甲。

虽然板甲显得沉重笨拙，但全套板甲的重量（若制作工艺足够精良，不会超过25 kg）实际上会分摊到穿戴者全身，优质的板甲还会有分节化设计，因此穿戴者能最大限度保持灵活性。

当代的防弹装甲通常会在内部安装大块由金属、陶瓷或合成材料制成的护板。

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, Knights start the game with +0 plate mail.

Plate mail can be found on the goal level of the Yeoman quest, placed on the altar of the lawful temple.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, plate mail grants 5 AC, 5 DR and MC3 while worn, and its weight is reduced to 225 aum.

Vlad the Impaler is always generated with plate mail. The militant cleric of the rebel party that serves as the collective quest nemeses for the Noble's default quest always generates with plate mail. Large dogs have an effective 1⁄1000 chance of generating with plate mail fitted to their size and body shape.

Soldier ants and queen bees generated on the Lawful Quest have an effective 3⁄50 chance of generating with plate mail fitted to their size and body shape. Fighter driver Amm Kamerel always generate with +1 plate mail, which has an equal probability of its material being either bronze, silver or glass. The four player monster knights generated on the Ancient Temple floor of the Chaos Temple Quest each have plate mail placed on their square.

There are a few artifact sets of plate mail:

  • Soulmirror is a neutral artifact that is made of mithril: it grants reflection, MC3, and drain resistance while worn, and can be enchanted to +7. One of the possible item sets for minor spire map inclusions contains Soulmirror, and it will be replaced with normal mithril plate mail and an amulet of reflection if Soulmirror was generated previously.
  • The Armor of Erebor is a lawful artifact that is the quest artifact for dwarven Nobles, and grants magic resistance, half physical damage, +10 AC, fire resistance and cold resistance while worn.
  • The Ringed Brass Armor is a chaotic intelligent artifact that is made of copper, and acts as the crowning gift for chaotic female half-dragon Nobles. It can be safely enchanted to +10, and acts as a "living item" while worn, having a chance per turn of lashing out at any hostile monsters within 2 squares of the wearer. It has three random effects when lashing out, and invoking the Armor will cause one of these effects to occur immediately.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, Croesus always generates with gold body armor - the armor has a 1⁄8 chance of being plate mail, and will otherwise be chain mail.

notdNetHack

In notdNetHack, in addition to dNetHack details, Berith and Dantalion are generated with plate mail when summoned by an Illithanachronounbinder.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, plate mail's weight is reduced to 350 aum.

human, orcish and centaur Knights start the game with plate mail.

Croesus has a 1⁄2 chance of generating with gold plate mail. Kas is always generated with plate mail.

Plate mail can be created at a forge by combining chain mail and splint mail. Plate mail can be used to forge a few items:

  • Plate mail can be combined with 3 dilithium crystals to create crystal plate mail.
  • Two sets of plate mail can be combined to create large splint mail.
  • Plate mail can be combined with a saddle to create barding.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, in addition to SLASH'EM details, the militant cleric in the rebel party of the Noble quest generates with plate mail, as in dNetHack.

The chest within the thieves' hideout in the village of the Town branch has a 1⁄20 chance of containing a blessed +5 plate mail named Erdrick's Armor, and an independent 3⁄20 chance of containing a cursed -5 plate mail named Alucart Mail. Erdrick's Armor is named for Erdrick, the title given to a legendary hero in the Dragon Quest series of video games, with the first three games featuring a main character descended from the hero; Alucart Mail is a type of mail found in the Castlevania series of video games, where it exists as an inferior knock-off of Alucard's real mail armor that can still have useful effects if paired with the other "Alucart" equipment.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, EvilHack details apply for plate mail, including generation and forging recipes.

Plate mail also generates on the temple altar in the Yeoman quest goal level, as in SLASH'EM.
